summary: The 'Ensuring a Qualified Civil Service Act of 2025' (EQUALS Act of 2025) amends Title 5 of the United States Code to modify probationary periods for federal employees. It extends the probationary period in the competitive service to two years (one year for preference eligibles) and establishes trial periods of two years (one year for preference eligibles) in the excepted service. The bill also affects adverse action procedures based on employee performance and requires the Director of the Office of Personnel Management to issue regulations. The act aims to ensure qualifications and suitability for federal employment.
